predicate.note: Frames file for 'summon' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry, Framenet entry Request.

example.name: transitive
example.text: The committee also has summoned Mr. Wall's predecessor, Edwin Gray.

example.name: all args
example.text: Air-raid sirens sounded the alarm at 2:25 a.m., *trace* summoning 12,000 air wardens to duty.

example.name: passive
example.text: In January 1980, Jerome Sanford, as assistant U.S. attorney, was summoned *trace* to a meeting with a Federal Bureau of Investigation agent assigned to the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms in Miami.
example.arg: a meeting with a Federal Bureau of Investigation agent assigned to the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms in Miami

example.name: watch out for purpose clauses!
example.text: The Ministry of International Trade and Industry summoned executives from the companies to ``make sure they understood'' the concern about such practices, according to a government spokesman.
example.arg: The Ministry of International Trade and Industry
to ``make sure they understood'' the concern about such practices, according to a government spokesman

example.name: destination and purpose
example.text: Mr. Gonzalez expressed concern over a report that the two had been summoned *trace* to Washington by Mr. Wall last week to discuss their testimony in advance.
example.arg: to discuss their testimony in advance

example.name: come out, come out, wherever you are
example.text: Among other things, the stronger devices may be able *trace* to summon forth half-forgotten memories and induce mood changes, neurologists say.
